p: To determine the prevalence of MR in these isolates, we analyzed the domain V region of the 23S rRNA gene in all isolates by PCR and DNA sequencing. MR mutations were found in 210 out of 419 isolates (50.1%). The fraction of MRMP strains was higher than 70% between 2011 and 2014 (71.4–81.8%), whereas in 2015 and after, it decreased significantly to 41.4–50% ( P < 0.01, Fisher’s exact test) ( Table 1). All of MRMP isolates but one (209/210, 99.5%) harbored the A2063G transition mutation, the most frequent MR mutation reported to date [ 7]. One strain isolated in 2013 had A2063T transversion ( Table 1).
